law.catch_line: Applications for permit -- Time for approval or rejection.

text.section: All applications for permits required by KRS 151.250 shall be in the form and manner prescribed by the cabinet.

Unless waived by the cabinet, all plans and specifications submitted for approval shall be drawn by an engineer, licensed to practice as a professional engineer under the provisions of KRS Chapter 322.

Upon receipt of all plans and specifications, the cabinet shall notify the applicant in writing within twenty (20) working days either that the permit will be issued or denied, or that certain modifications in the plans or specifications must be made before a permit will be issued.

metadata.lrc-note: (10/29/96). Pursuant to KRS 7.136(2), original references to "division" in subsections (1), (2), and (3) of this statute have been changed to "cabinet" to reflect reorganizations relating to the former Division of Water. See 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 285, sec. 1; 1982 Ky. Acts ch. 214, secs. 1 and 2; 1982 Ky. Acts ch. 393, sec. 50(3).
